title: Confession and Covenant
shortSummary: Ezra 10 recounts the heartfelt confession of sin by Ezra and the people of Israel regarding their intermarriage with foreign wives, which was against God's law. The chapter details the covenant made to put away these wives and the process of repentance and restoration, highlighting the seriousness of obedience to God's commands.
timeline: c. 458 BC - Post-exilic period during the return from Babylonian captivity

keyCharacters.name: Ezra
keyCharacters.description: A priest and scribe who leads Israel in confession and covenant renewal, urging the people to repent from intermarriage with foreign wives.

keyCharacters.name: Shechaniah
keyCharacters.description: A son of Jehiel who encourages Ezra and the people to make a covenant to put away foreign wives, offering hope for Israel's restoration.

keyCharacters.name: Jonathan son of Asahel
keyCharacters.description: One of the men appointed to oversee the investigation and resolution of the issue of foreign wives.

keyCharacters.name: Jahaziah son of Tikvah
keyCharacters.description: Another appointed official who assisted in addressing the problem of intermarriage.

definitions.definition: Foreign women from the peoples of the land who were not part of Israel and whose marriages were forbidden by the Mosaic Law.
A solemn agreement between God and His people, often involving commitments to obey His commands.
An act of disobedience or sin against God's law.
Leaders of the priestly order responsible for temple worship and spiritual oversight.

outline.heading: Ezra’s Prayer and People’s Repentance
outline.description: Ezra prays and confesses Israel’s sin of intermarriage, leading to a large gathering of people who weep and agree to make a covenant to put away foreign wives, demonstrating the power of godly leadership and communal repentance.

outline.heading: Proclamation and Gathering of the People
outline.description: Ezra mourns deeply for the transgression; a proclamation is made for all the exiles to gather in Jerusalem under penalty of exclusion, showing the seriousness of the covenant and the call to holiness.

outline.heading: Ezra’s Call to Confession and Separation
outline.description: Ezra confronts the people with their sin and calls them to confess and separate from foreign wives, emphasizing obedience to God’s law as essential for Israel’s restoration.

outline.heading: Investigation and Resolution
outline.description: Appointed leaders, including Levites, begin the process of examining the marriages, illustrating the need for careful and just administration in matters of covenant faithfulness.

outline.heading: List of Those Who Took Foreign Wives
outline.description: A detailed record of priests, Levites, and Israelites who had taken foreign wives, highlighting the widespread nature of the sin and the comprehensive response required for repentance.

application: Confess your sins sincerely before God, recognizing the need for repentance and restoration in your life.
Be willing to obey God’s commands fully, even when it requires difficult personal sacrifice or separation from sinful influences.
Encourage and support godly leadership that calls the church and community to holiness and covenant faithfulness.
Understand the importance of corporate repentance and accountability within the body of Christ.

keyVerses.text: Now when Ezra had prayed, and when he had confessed, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there assembled unto him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children: for the people wept very sore.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the power of prayer and confession to move the hearts of the people toward repentance.

keyVerses.text: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord, and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the commitment to obey God’s law as a community and the seriousness of covenant renewal.

keyVerses.text: Now therefore make confession unto the LORD God of your fathers, and do his pleasure: and separate yourselves from the people of the land, and from the strange wives.
keyVerses.significance: A clear call to repentance and separation from sin to restore fellowship with God.
